verses.verse: Now Sarah <S%H8283><s%> lived <S%H9132><s%> <S%H1961><s%> one hundred <S%H3967><s%> and twenty-seven years; <S%H8141><s%> [these were] the years <S%H8141><s%> of the life <S%H9132><s%> of Sarah. <S%H8283><s%>

And Sarah <S%H8283><s%> died <S%H4191><s%> in Kiriath-arba (that is, Hebron <S%H2275><s%>) in the land <S%H776><s%> of Canaan; <S%H3667><s%> and Abraham <S%H85><s%> went <S%H935><s%> in to mourn <S%H5594><s%> for Sarah <S%H8283><s%> and to weep <S%H1058><s%> for her.
Then Abraham <S%H85><s%> rose <S%H6965><s%> from before <S%H6440><s%> his dead, <S%H4191><s%> and spoke <S%H1696><s%> to the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Heth, <S%H2845><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%>

"I am a stranger <S%H1616><s%> and a sojourner <S%H8453><s%> among <S%H5973><s%> you; give <S%H5414><s%> me a burial <S%H6913><s%> site <S%H272><s%> among <S%H5973><s%> you, that I may bury <S%H6912><s%> my dead <S%H4191><s%> out of my sight. <S%H6440><s%>"

"Hear <S%H8085><s%> us, my lord, <S%H113><s%> you are a mighty <S%H430><s%> prince <S%H5387><s%> among <S%H8432><s%> us; bury <S%H6912><s%> your dead <S%H4191><s%> in the choicest <S%H4005><s%> of our graves; <S%H6913><s%> none <S%H376><s%> <S%H3808><s%> of us will refuse <S%H3607><s%> you his grave <S%H6913><s%> for burying <S%H6912><s%> your dead. <S%H4191><s%>"
So Abraham <S%H85><s%> rose <S%H6965><s%> and bowed <S%H7812><s%> to the people <S%H5971><s%> of the land, <S%H776><s%> the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Heth. <S%H2845><s%>

And he spoke <S%H1696><s%> with them, saying, <S%H559><s%> "If <S%H518><s%> it is your wish <S%H5315><s%> [for me] to bury <S%H6912><s%> my dead <S%H4191><s%> out of my sight, <S%H6440><s%> hear <S%H8085><s%> me, and approach <S%H6293><s%> Ephron <S%H6085><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Zohar <S%H6714><s%> for me,

that he may give <S%H5414><s%> me the cave <S%H4631><s%> of Machpelah <S%H4375><s%> which <S%H834><s%> he owns, which <S%H834><s%> is at the end <S%H7097><s%> of his field; <S%H7704><s%> for the full <S%H4392><s%> price <S%H3701><s%> let him give <S%H5414><s%> it to me in your presence <S%H8432><s%> for a burial <S%H6913><s%> site. <S%H272><s%> "

Now Ephron <S%H6085><s%> was sitting <S%H3427><s%> among <S%H8432><s%> the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Heth; <S%H2845><s%> and Ephron <S%H6085><s%> the Hittite <S%H2850><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> Abraham <S%H85><s%> in the hearing <S%H241><s%> of the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Heth; <S%H2845><s%> [even] of all <S%H3605><s%> who went <S%H935><s%> in at the gate <S%H8179><s%> of his city, <S%H5892><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%>

In the presence <S%H5869><s%> of the sons <S%H1121><s%> of my people <S%H5971><s%> I give <S%H5414><s%> it to you; bury <S%H6912><s%> your dead. <S%H4191><s%>"

And he spoke <S%H1696><s%> to Ephron <S%H6085><s%> in the hearing <S%H241><s%> of the people <S%H5971><s%> of the land, <S%H776><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "If <S%H518><s%> you will only <S%H389><s%> please <S%H3863><s%> listen <S%H8085><s%> to me; I will give <S%H5414><s%> the price <S%H3701><s%> of the field, <S%H7704><s%> accept <S%H3947><s%> [it] from me, that I may bury <S%H6912><s%> my dead <S%H4191><s%> there. <S%H8033><s%>"
Then Ephron <S%H6085><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> Abraham, <S%H85><s%> saying <S%H559><s%> to him,

"My lord, <S%H113><s%> listen <S%H8085><s%> to me; a piece of land <S%H776><s%> worth four <S%H702><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> shekels <S%H8255><s%> of silver, <S%H3701><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> is that between <S%H996><s%> me and you? So bury <S%H6912><s%> your dead. <S%H4191><s%>"

And Abraham <S%H85><s%> listened <S%H8085><s%> to Ephron; <S%H6085><s%> and Abraham <S%H85><s%> weighed <S%H8254><s%> out for Ephron <S%H6085><s%> the silver <S%H3701><s%> which <S%H834><s%> he had named <S%H1696><s%> in the hearing <S%H241><s%> of the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Heth, <S%H2845><s%> four <S%H702><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> shekels <S%H8255><s%> of silver, <S%H3701><s%> commercial <S%H5503><s%> standard. <S%H5674><s%>

So Ephron's field, <S%H7704><s%> which <S%H834><s%> was in Machpelah, <S%H4375><s%> which <S%H834><s%> faced <S%H6440><s%> Mamre, <S%H4471><s%> the field <S%H7704><s%> and cave <S%H4631><s%> which <S%H834><s%> was in it, and all <S%H3605><s%> the trees <S%H6086><s%> which <S%H834><s%> were in the field, <S%H7704><s%> that were within all <S%H3605><s%> the confines <S%H5439><s%> of its border, <S%H1366><s%> were deeded <S%H6965><s%> over <S%H6965><s%>

to Abraham <S%H85><s%> for a possession <S%H4736><s%> in the presence <S%H5869><s%> of the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Heth, <S%H2845><s%> before all <S%H3605><s%> who went <S%H935><s%> in at the gate <S%H8179><s%> of his city. <S%H5892><s%>

And after <S%H310><s%> this, <S%H3651><s%> Abraham <S%H85><s%> buried <S%H6912><s%> Sarah <S%H8283><s%> his wife <S%H802><s%> in the cave <S%H4631><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%> at Machpelah <S%H4375><s%> facing <S%H6440><s%> Mamre <S%H4471><s%> (that is, Hebron <S%H2275><s%>) in the land <S%H776><s%> of Canaan. <S%H3667><s%>
